Text: ...Wh-What do you think?

Well, firstly, regarding the plot of "Little Red
Riding Hood"...

This scene here where she drinks her grandma's blood
as wine and eats her flesh as steak...

And also this one here, where she takes off each item
of clothing...

They're a little too extreme—you might want to remove
them.

What! Really? But they're an integral part of the
story!

(For starters, I don't want to omit a single word of
the tale Master Shadow told me!)

Hmm... Personally, I agree, but I think our readers
will be slightly taken aback if they read this.

Even if that wasn't the case, extreme depictions in
newspapers are likely to draw scrutiny from the
Midgar Kingdom and the Church.

The MNA has maintained its current neutrality for
many years. We don't want to make ourselves an
easy target for external forces.
Tsk...

Another thing...regarding the plot for "Spider
Man-eater"...

I feel this mechanical giant the hero rides in is
outlandish and far-fetched.

I also think it's too overpowered that the giant slays its
opponent with 100% accuracy every time it throws its
sword.
What...?!

(But a shadowbroker always slays their enemies
instantly—that's right, just like Master Shadow!)
(This editor utterly lacks real-world experience!)

The hero's abilities are attractive enough without
relying on the giant.

Other elements you could include are, for example,
having someone close to him...such as an uncle, die
because of his mistakes, making the hero realize that
with great power comes great responsibility—
Enough!
Ms. Natsume?!

(If I let my anger get the better of me here, I could
mess up this whole situation.)
...I-I'll rewrite them!
...Thank you.

I understand this work may take some getting used to,
but I appreciate your effort.
Uggghhh!!

If I were a best-selling writer, that damn editor
would be fired—fired!—just like that! Gone! Poof!
...Anyway, ranting about it won't rewrite the plot!

Still...I don't want to cut a single word from the
Shadow Wisdom that Master Shadow passed
on to me!

...But if I don't get approval for the plot, I won't
be able to infiltrate the MNA as a writer.

Ohhh... The means and ends are getting so jumbled up
in my head that nothing is making sense anymore!

Meaningless all-nighters, meaningless deliberating...
My mind and body won't hold up at this rate! I should
take tomorrow off to clear my head—

I'm assigned to Master Shadow next week! I-I've got
to hurry and prepare!
Your mind seems elsewhere, Beta.
Huh?!
N-No...um, it's nothing...

You say, "It's nothing," but I didn't ask you
anything.
It's almost as if you're saying, "It's something."
Master Shadow...my sincere apologies!
The thing is, right now, I—
...I-I'm struggling with a work deadline!

A work deadline? Ah, I'm guessing Alpha gave you some
difficult task.
Yes, well...I'm failing at it miserably.

I'll solve most of my problems if I swallow my pride
and compromise, but I can't seem to do that...
You want to see it through?
I...don't even know myself...
Hmm...

Well, it's your problem, so I shouldn't be getting
involved.

But if it were me, whatever I'd do, I'd make sure I
have no regrets.
Master Shadow...

Whether you choose to stay on or quit, finish or not,
it's essential that the decision is yours and that you
own up to it.

Never let others sway you when it comes to making
important decisions. Live a life that's true to you,
even if it leads to mistakes or failures.
In other words, you are the hero of your own story.
(And...scene. I've always wanted to use that line.)
The hero of my own story...

The Shadow Wisdom that Master Shadow imparted to me
is that I am the hero of my own story!
I...Beta...want to be of service to Master Shadow!

And...I want to write down every single detail of
Master Shadow's story!

I'm sure my wish to be a writer...stems from this
overflowing desire!
I, as the hero of my own story...

...wish to stand by Master Shadow's side and record
his hero's story!
W-Wait...that's it...!
My creative juices...are starting to floooow!!!
Heheh...!

I've had a chance to read your work! Ms. Natsume...
the plot is incredible!

The hero appears to be an ordinary noble boy—neither
the source of disappointment nor pride to those around him.

The truth is, however, that he is a dark knight who
wields tremendous power.

The climax scene is especially cathartic! The hero
and his subordinates race to rescue his sister,
unleash their hidden powers, and utterly lay
waste to the bandits—it's brilliant!

Does this story end on that final scene...where the
girls under his command depart for a greater
purpose?

I'd love to find out what the heroes get up to
afterward, not just as an editor, but as a
reader!
I still haven't written what happens next.

Because, much like my own story, "his" and "their"
stories...have only just begun!

Emerging author Natsume Kafka's debut novel is given
a limited serialization in the Midgar Times.

"The Eminence in Shadow" achieves popularity with a
large readership, resulting in the broad expansion of
the newspaper's own reader base.

The MNA signs an exclusive contract with Natsume
Kafka through Luna, Ltd. in the Midgar Kingdom.

Thus begins the story of one writer who would come to
represent a new era.
